snippet.title: 'The Americans' recap: 'Martial Eagle' sounds better than it feels
snippet.description: In "The Americans," the promise of heaven may be more dangerous than the torments of hell.

snippet.title: When the FDA said it would regulate e-cigarettes, the reaction was swift.
snippet.description: When the FDA said it would regulate e-cigarettes, the reaction was swift.

snippet.title: This history of the Profumo Affair helps us understand Fox News
snippet.description: A sharp British political history shows us that Fox News's approach is not new, but that it is very, very effective.

snippet.title: Syrian activists accuse Assad of new gas attacks
snippet.description: Syrian government forces have attacked rebel-held areas with poisonous chlorine gas in recent weeks and months, leaving men, women and children coughing, choking and gasping for breath, according to Associated Press interviews with more than a dozen activists, medics and residents on the opposition side.

snippet.title: FDA outlines plan to regulate e-cigarettes
snippet.description: The agency is moving slowing, creating a "framework" while scientific study continues.

snippet.title: Dirty Dollars: That paper money is teeming with germs
snippet.description: Also: the price of home ownership and the benefits of financial literacy

snippet.title: At Battle of the Crater, black troops prove their courage
snippet.description: Attempt to break Southern line is botched, but African Americans don't hesitate when sent into a losing fight.

snippet.title: How, after 60 years, Brown v. Board of Education succeeded -- and didn't
snippet.description: The Brown decision wiped out the "separate but equal" rule, but did its accomplish its main goal?

snippet.title: Nora Roberts's 'The Collector' debuts at No. 1. Todd Burpo's 'Heaven in For Real' and Michael Lewis's 'Flash Boys' continuing strong
snippet.description: The books Washington has been reading.
